name: albert_us-county-level-uv-exposure
title: US County Level UV Exposure
description:
County Level UV Exposure Data for the Continental United States

[County Level UV Exposure Data for the Continental United States](https://gis.cancer.gov/tools/uv-exposure/)  

Exposure to ultraviolet radiation has long been recognized as the most important environmental risk factor for melanoma . Exposures in early childhood may be most important and there is evidence that cumulative UV exposure and the time spent outdoors may increase melanoma risk. The following dataset has been developed in response to a need for an objective metric of individual UV exposure for which the accuracy of exposure estimates is known.  

Data:
[UV Data - Counties (XLSX - 143KB)](https://gis.cancer.gov/tools/uv-exposure/uv-county.xlsx)  

Peer Reviewed Publication Describing the Methodology behind the UV Exposure Dataset:
A Comparison of Thiessen Polygon, Kriging, and Spline Models of Potential UV Exposure external link. Tatalovich, Z., Wilson, J.P., and Cockburn, M.G. Cartography and Geographic Information Science. 2006, 33(3): 217-237  
[Paywalled: A Comparison of Thiessen Polygon, Kriging, and Spline Models of Potential UV Exposure](http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/pdf/10.1559/152304006779077318?needAccess=true)  
[Sci-Hub Link: A Comparison of Thiessen Polygon, Kriging, and Spline Models of Potential UV Exposure](http://www.tandfonline.com.sci-hub.cc/doi/pdf/10.1559/152304006779077318?needAccess=true)
